categoryContent.paragraphOne: When you sign up for anything online, put the website’s name as your middle name.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: That way when you receive spam or ad emails, you will know who sold your info.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: When using Google, add '-site:pinterest.*' (without quotes) to your query to avoid receiving hundreds of useless Pinterest results.
Yelp replaces restaurant phone numbers with a special number that charges that business a marketing fee.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: If you find a good restaurant on Yelp Google their phone number instead so they don't lose any money.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: If you ever need a program you want for free (for example a video / photo editor) don’t search for 'free' but search for 'open source' to avoid limited trial versions, adverts and malware.
Don't argue with people on online platforms.
categoryContent.paragraphTwo: People tend to be more defensive of their opinions and more aggressive with their words. It will only ruin your day and waste your time.

categoryContent.paragraphOne: When browsing en.wikipedia.org, you can replace 'en' with 'simple' to bring up simple English wikipedia, where everything is explained like you're five.
